title: contact
name: contact
description: A contact can be a lead, client or supplier, depending on its type field. Use the filter[type] parameter to show only contacts of a kind. Use this resource instead of clients, as they are deprecated and dropped in the future.

is_employee.description: An employee gets number, organisation, tax and vat_number from its parent. If you set any of these, they are overwritten. When changing a parent-contact the fields on his direct child-employees are updated too.

number.description: Unique number, auto-created by SK for new contacts(client, supplier) without number.

organisation.description: Name of a company. This or lastname must be present

last_name.description: Last name of a person. At least this or the organisation field must be filled for new records

gender.description: Can be empty for a company. Is used in salutation

notes.description: Notes for a contact. For day to day information you should use comments instead.

position.description: Position of a person in a company.

title.description: Academical title of a person e.g. Dr., Prof

tax_number.description: Tax number, normally applies to a private person

vat_number.description: VAT number, for a company or person paying value added taxes.

url.description: An url associated with the person, e.g its company website.

tag_list.description: Space separated list of tags. Are split and saved as Tag objects on create, update.

created_at.description: Date the record was created in SK. Never changes afterwards.

updated_at.description: Last date when the record was edited.

language.description: Should be a valid language short-code: de-DE, fr, en-GB; like defined in your account language menu. When the client is emailed, a localized version of a multi-language template(email, pdf) will be used if available. The language will also be set for new documents.

currency.description: Currency code as defined by the ISO 4217 standard(3-letter UPCASE: EUR, USD). If set the currency is taken for new documents.

payment_method.description: Default payment method for used for new documemts

bank_iban.description: IBAN Number of the bank account. Is validated

lock_version.description: Increased on every edit, so SK can detect/prevent a concurrent edit by another user. First save wins.

cash_discount.description: Default cash discount for new invoices.

due_days.description: Default due days for new invoices.

address_field.description: Returns the address field used on new docs. Consist of Organisation name and default(first) address

addresses.description: A client can have many addresses, sorted by date descending(new first). Default address is the most recent one.

team_id.description: A team uuid. If set only the team and its parent teams can see the record. The team is set for all new documents and related objects like comments, attachments, emails. When changed ALL related objects are updated with the new team!!

lead_source.description: Lead source describing where a contact came from e.g. a campaign name, website, facebook, URL

lead_ref.description: Lead reference e.g. a tracking id, web-url

lead_date.description: Lead date e.g. date of first contact with your company. YYYY-MM-DD

converted_at.description: Date the contact converted from lead to client or any other contact type (supplier)

page.title: Page
page.description: In paginated results set the page to look for

per_page.title: Per page
per_page.description: Results per page. Default is 10, max is 100

filter[q].title: Search
filter[q].description: Wildcard search in first, last_name, organisation, email, number

filter[organisation].title: Organisation
filter[organisation].description: Search by organisation. Searches by organisation begins with name%

filter[tags].title: Tags
filter[tags].description: Filter by a space delimited list of tags

filter[ids].title: Contacts
filter[ids].description: A single or a list of contacts uuids, comma separated

filter[created_at_from].title: From date
filter[created_at_from].description: Objects with a creation on/after the date(>=). ISO 8601 format YYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+z or just a date YYY-MM-DD. If date is given the time is set to the start of the day(00:00:00) so all objects created on this day are included. A time should be already utc time

filter[created_at_to].title: To date
filter[created_at_to].description: Objects with a creation until the date(<=). ISO 8601 format YYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+z or just a date YYY-MM-DD. If date is given the time is set to the end of the day(23:59:59) so all objects created on that day are included. A time should be already utc time.

filter[birthday_from].title: From birthday date
filter[birthday_from].description: Contacts with a birthday after and on the date. Leave the birthday-to date blank to only search on this day. YYYY-MM-DD

filter[birthday_to].title: To birthday date
filter[birthday_to].description: Contacts with a birthday date before and on the date. YYYY-MM-DD

filter[creator_ids].title: Creator
filter[creator_ids].description: Objects created by the given users uuids, comma separated

filter[number].title: By number
filter[number].description: Search by number where the number is matched from the start: number%

filter[languages].title: Languages
filter[languages].description: A single or a list of language codes, comma separated

sort_by.title: Sort by
sort_by.description: Sort the results by the given field => number

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Sort the results in ASC or DESC

template_id.title: Template
template_id.description: UUID of an email template to use. If present template fields like subject, body, attachments are used for the current email.

send.title: Send email
send.description: Schedule email for sending. Omit this parameter or set value to 0 or false(String or Integer) to keep email as draft.

archived_pdf.title: Attach archived pdf
archived_pdf.description: Adds the archived pdf from the related resource(if it has one).
